word: I was shown the dark and deadly influence of B. Some have hung on to him. He throws around him a very religious garb, appears very mild and devoted, but corruption and rebellion are within and yet some will cling to him, although his influence will draw them in the dark every time. His heart is at war with the work of the third angel. His heart is at war with the visions. He despises them. Yet he has many sympathizers. . . . There are quite a number in New York who have taken a rebellious course like Dathan and Abiram.--Letter 11, 1862, pp. 1-3. (To J. N. Andrews, November 9, 1862.)
